original_title: Sri Lanka govt to address Human Rights Commission’s staff shortages: PMD
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has told the Human Rights Commission that prompt measures will be taken to address staff shortages at the Human Rights Commission (HRC).

A statement from the president’s media division (PMD) said the chairman and members of the HRC had briefed Wickremesinghe on Friday July 28 on the issues facing the commission which the PMD said has received nearly 11,000 public complaints.
The challenges arising from a shortage of staff in effectively addressing these complaints was also raised at the meeting.

According to the statement, President Wickremesinghe had assured them that prompt measures would be taken to address the staff shortage issue and find swift solutions to the pending complaints. He had highlighted the importance of resolving these matters efficiently.

The president had also requested the HRC to develop and present a comprehensive set of guidelines for government officials and the police. He believed that such guidelines could potentially help reduce the number of complaints reaching the commission, the PMD said. (Colombo/Jul29/2023)
